I do not recommend using the Media Library because we will be deprecating it [and transitioning customer projects to use the Content hub](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/279-migrating-media-library-items-to-content-hub-media-library-sunset) for all assets.
The [combined content selector](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/customization/extend-the-administration-interface/ui-form-components/reference-admin-ui-form-components#combined-content-selector) has the functionality you need as long as you are using content items in [the Content hub to model your assets](https://docs.kentico.com/x/content_item_assets_xp).
The best way to stay aware of the latest features in the product is to read the Refresh blog posts which we publish each month.
Here are some recent sections of those blog posts that cover managing assets and media in Xperience's Content hub.
* <https://community.kentico.com/blog/xperience-by-kentico-refresh-april-17-2025#more-media-asset-management> * <https://community.kentico.com/blog/xperience-by-kentico-refresh-march-24-2025#asset-auto-tagging-and-metadata-with-aira> * <https://community.kentico.com/blog/xperience-by-kentico-refresh-february-20-2025#ai-powered-image-transformations-with-aira> * <https://community.kentico.com/blog/xperience-by-kentico-refresh-december-12-2024#digital-asset-management-updates>
